mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Van Zandt, William Thompson
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Assumed an understanding concerning their daughter Fanny could be reached after speaking with Dr. Mutter; now that he realizes they will oppose every effort of reconciliation, he intends to ask their daughter to marry, with or without their consent, as soon as he is in a position to do so. Autographed Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: William Thompson Van Zandt, New York, to Eliza M. (Douglas) Monroe , n.p., 29 July 1845.
